guide.title: Installing Avidemux
guide.abstract: Simple tips and help for installing avidemux

body.p: You will need a unix based machine, preferably x86. It also works to some extend on Sparc and Macs

tr.ti: it is optional but believe me, you want it!
If you do VCD/SVCD/... on x86 you want it ! (5 x faster)

body.warn: Avidemux2 will be statically linked to 0.9 OR 1.x

body.p: Take extra care at the end where a recap of what has been detected appears .For me it looks like this: nasm found : /usr/bin/nasm MMX is ON cpu done GTK+ version : 2.2.4 Divx5.0.5 ? : yes *** DISABLED *** Xvid Codec : yes Mad decoder : yes OSS : yes ALSA : yes Xvideo : yes Lame : yes Ogg Vorbis : yes A52/AC3 : yes FFMPEG : yes ARTS : yes FreeType : yes XML2 : yes Toolame : /usr/local/bin/toolame Lame : /usr/bin/lame locale : ${prefix}/share/locale Little endian cpu : yes
If you think something is missing, check that you have also installed the -dev package.
Configure will also build lavcodec library.
When configure is done, make then make install . There is a pack of translations (a beginning of start of internationalisation) also installed.
It fails saying cannot open gtkxxx. Usually it means pkg-config/gtk+/glib is not installed or configured

section.title: It fails at link, with jpeg mmx
section.body:
Look at /usr/lib/liblavjpeg.la (or in /usr/local/lib) if you find this :
dependency_libs=' -L/usr/src/redhat/BUILD/mjpegtools-1.6.0/jpeg-mmx -ljpeg-mmx'
change it to
dependency_libs=''
Thanks Jens for that one that hits a lot RedHat and Suse users.
